brief_description: Examine the response of primary NK cells from subjects with a history of asymptomatic or severe infection with West nile virus
brief_title: Natural Killer cells in resistance to infection with West Nile virus
condition_studied: Immunologic signatures of response to West Nile virus
description: Examine the response of primary NK cells from subjects with a history of asymptomatic or severe infection with West nile virus
endpoints: Intracellular cytokine production by NK cells
hypothesis: Individual variations in immune responses may help define successful resistance to infection with West Nile virus
objectives: Define signatures for immune responsiveness by functional systems immunology
official_title: Deciphering the role of Natural Killer cells in resistance to infection with West Nile virus

program.contract_name: Defining signatures for immune responsiveness by functional systems immunology HIPC1
